reviewText:
Casual it's tagged and casual it is.
Great fun though for an hour or so.  Unfortunately the LUCK factor is very prominent. There's only so much you can do with 'good tactics' .
Still I have enjoyed this simple board game very much. The mechanics are working as they should and the graphics are suitably subdued.
Perfect game to spend your inbetween hours on.

reviewText: Senet is a board game for two players against AI or hotseat, like an easier version of backgammon. It was created by Egyptians in a tech park (smart village") outside of Cairo
date: Egypt.\n\nThe second video on the store page shows some of the gameplay. The game is quite similar to backgammon
recommended: except you're playing in the same direction
hoursPlayed: and a blockade (sort of) is formed by two or more pawns in sequence - there's never more than one pawn on any space of the board. The game provides little backstory. It is a single player against AI (3 levels of difficulty) or hot-seat two-player gameplay. The game runs fine even on older computers.\n\nThe pieces move across the board in a Z-shapes path
voteText: i.e. right on the top row
votesHelpful: then right on the bottom row; your aim is to move all of your pieces off the board before your opponent does. Since there can never be more than one piece on any square
votesTotal: you can generally only move to unoccupied squares; you can also swap position with an opponent's pawn if it has no other pawn adjacent to protect it. Your "dice" are 4 sticks colored red and white; the number of whites is your roll
votesFunny: but if you have all red
commentsCount: that counts as 5. You get to roll again on any 1
column17: as often as they keep occurring; play switches to your opponent as soon as you roll a 2 or 3 and make your move. To reduce swapping in the endgame
column18: every pawn needs to reach the 5th to last square (with the paddles)
column20: a 5 moves it off the board
column22: 3 and 2 move it to end squares where it needs to stay until moved off the board with a throw of 1
column23: 2 or 3 respectively; and a 1 (which must be taken if no other pawn is movable) moves it to the water square
column24: which moves it up a row to the rebirth ankh
column26: to the first unoccupied square before it; the same thing happens to pawns that get swapped out on the end squares. Strategy is generally to keep your stones grouped (any group of two or more is safe from swapping)
column27: preventing the opponent from forming groups and setting your own stones back
column28: while trying to swap his own stones back.\n\nI'd say that games are faster than backgammon because pawns that get "hit" don't move back as much; and the strategy is slightly easier
column29: for the same reason. The rules are easy to pick up because the game marks all of your pieces that have legal moves.\n\nIf you plan to play against a friend
column30: I'd recommend the tablet version (iOS or Android) since that's more comfortable than hotseat on a PC (the board is probably too small for a smartphone screen though); but there's nothing wrong with the Steam version. You're getting a simple board game
column31: no bells and whistles; while you could easily make your own board or use a free flash version (or Tabletop Simulator for online multiplayer)
column32: this'll provide an AI to play against on your own and helps you learn the rules."

reviewText:
Pros:
Cheap (especially at the $2.99 promotional price)
Genuinely fun gameplay; it's sort of comparable to Sorry!
Difficult AI
No obvious bugs

Cons:
Mediocre graphics
Hotseat-only multiplayer

8/10. It could use plenty of polish but it's a good way to kill twenty minutes here and there regardless.

reviewText:
Egyptian Senet is a casual game based on the most ancient board game in history.

Overall, this game offers a very relaxing and fun experience, and it's perfect if you wish to just chill out in your spare time.
Before starting to play Egyptian Senet, you should really read the rules and learn how to game mechanics work. They are still fairly easy to understand, so you don't have to worry too much. Also keep in mind that there are different difficulty settings, to suit your taste.
Once in game, the gameplay is simple to understand, but at the same time very fun and engaging. There's a local multiplayer mode available if you wish to share this experience with a friend.
On top of all of this, the design is great and accurate. The illustrations are cool and they contribute to the atmosphere of the game.

Overall, I strongly recommend this game. Whether you enjoy board games or not, you will still find Egyptian Senet fun and fresh.
voteText: 9 of 9 people (100%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
According to the description, Seneth is an Ancient Egypt table game. Most probably, its an oldest game that requires players to use counters on the desk.
The idea of the game is quite similar to backgammon, as you start from the one side of the desk and the point is to move your counters to another one, while bothering your opponent to do so. However, four sticks are used instead of the rolling dice.
It was my first experience with the game, so I would like all novices to understand how easy it is. However, you'd have to practice and think in advance in order to become really worthy player. The rules are described in the main menu; everything is quite simple and understandable, so once you'll enter the game, you'll find out how to play fast enough.

Let's move to the most important aspects of the game:
Music. Music in the game matches its overall appearance great and even adds some notes to its atmosphere of an Ancient Egypt. Music is calm and cute, it doesn't go boring and never bothers you while playing.

Graphics. The game looks quite beautiful and nice, furthermore, enhances an atmosphere of an Ancient Egypt.The eyes don't go tired even after playing few hours in a row, so you can hold even quite long sessions with no pauses.

Gameplay. As I mentioned above, the game is quite easy-to-master. There is nothing complicated in controls, though it's a table game. There are few difficulty levels that make the game much more interesting.In conclusion, for those who're still not sure: if you're a fan either of Ancient Egypt theme or of table games, you'd better buy without even thinking. Refill your collection with one more exciting and interesting game and enhance your playing skills.

reviewText: I have always loved playing board games different then the usual. At the price this one is very unique and worth while to any game collector who likes to play something different every night. It didn't take me too long to figure out the rules. I spent a couple of hours playing before I knew it.\n\nThe only real lacking component of this game would be to polish it up a little more. The rules were plain text, though it was still easy enough to follow along. Overall good value for a different kind of game.

reviewText: Never played it before, but I assume this is an accurate representation of the board game.  It's just not a very fun board game.  Almost all luck, lots of rolling over and over again because no moves are available, and the game moves annoyingly slowly in switching back and forth between players to let you roll again.

reviewText:
Egyptian Senet is a casual puzzle game that can be played either solo or with a friend on the same device.
At first I was a little confused but after 5 minutes of playing, as well as rereading the tutorial I came to fully understand the rules.

Pros:
Easy to learn but unique gameplay ( reminded me of sorry!)
Hot seat multiplayer
Interesting music
Multiple difficulty options
Low price!

Cons:
No save game feature
No internet multiplayer

In summary, the game is great for killing time (took me about 20-30 minutes a game), but I do think it would be a lot more fun with internet multiplayer. It would also be nice to be able to save single player games so we could finish them later, but other then that I think this game is pretty solid.
voteText: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
It's a small and modest indie board game, it doesn't try to be big or epic, it's just a casual board game.

I've played this game with a friend and it was pretty fun. It is a casual board game that resembles backgamoon, but I guess it is a little bit easier (cause I cannot understand how to play bg but I've learned to play this one pretty fast).

You can read the rules before starting a match, but it is pretty easy to understand the game by just playing it, even more easy if you are playing against another human.

If you want something to casually play, with a friend or not, and like board games, I totally recommend this one.

reviewText: No, the graphics arn't great.  Yes, it can lag very slightly now and then.\n\nYet, I recommend this game.  Playing a piece of history really feels good, and the game itself is fun.  If there were another game of its type on the market I might rate this a little more harshly, but seeing as there isn't (to my knowledge), it's getting my thumbs up.

reviewText: This game is phenominal.  It is easy to pick up and easy to play.  The sound is great.  This is one of those very iconic games.  I see a lot of people that are complaining about the graphics, not sure what they are complaining about, this is a board game and most of the focus is on the gameplay.  This game is fun when you are playing by yourself or even with a friend!  I highly recommend this game for anyone looking fora board game that is out of the ordinary, but easy to pick up!

reviewText:
NOTE: I received a key explicitly for reviewing Egyptian Senet. How I perceived this game whether it’s positively or negatively is entirely up to me.

Egyptian Senet is a casual board game in which you have to move all of your pawns to the far end of the board. It's somewhat similar to backgammon and checkers, It is also the earliest known board game in history.


PROS :

Price -  For what it's worth the game is pretty cheap (Less than $5)

Gameplay - At the start I was pretty confused on the rules and set in the game but after 5 minutes i was having fun, It's more fun and exciting if you are playing with someone since the game is designed for 2 players

No Bugs - It's no suprise that no game-breaking bug is found since it's a board game with no delicate mechanics

CONS :

Graphics - The game could be better if the graphics would be improved.

Multiplayer - Hotseat Multiplayer is nice but i think the game's replayability can be lengthen by having a online multiplayer

Overall : 7.5/10 - Egyptian Senet is great game for it's price i would recommend getting this on sale for the optimal Bang for your Buck"
"

reviewText: What started as a good idea to combine Egypt and a boardgame ended as a deception for me. This game is like Sorry! the boardgame with the annoying rule to land on the goal precisely. The music doesn't sound anything like Egypt. The pictures are good but there is no animation, just sliding pieces and premade roll of sticks (as dices). The rules are printed in a long text to scroll down instead of a neat tutorial. Overall, who wins the game is purely random and I don't like.

reviewText:
Egyptian Senet is one of the oldest known board game from predynastic and ancient Egypt, it is the earliest known record of a backgammon, checkers and chess like games.
Game is straightforward and true to the original. The graphics are nice.

Pros:
Easy to learn, hard to master.
Local multiplayer
Ritualistic music

Cons:
No online multiplayer

I recommend this to anyone who's interested in board games or getting into board games.
